subject: Sales
title: Jordan Belfort: The Wolf's Rise and Fall
description: A fast breakdown of Jordan Belfort: The Wolf's Rise and Fall for builders.

hook.text: Jordan Belfort earned $50 million a year selling penny stocks. Then the FBI knocked on his door.

buildup.text: He built Stratton Oakmont into a high-pressure sales machine with spectacular short-term results.

discovery.text: His method was pure manipulation: fake urgency, manufactured scarcity, emotional arm-twisting.

twist.text: He defrauded investors of $200 million. The spectacular results were built on spectacular lies.

climax.text: Prison and disgrace followed. Belfort became a cautionary tale: skill without ethics self-destructs.

punchline.text: The greatest closer closed himself into a prison cell.

quiz.question: What ultimately happened to Jordan Belfort's sales empire?
options: He was convicted of fraud and went to prison
